a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: Logical Model representing the EU Vaccination Certificate Model

definition.value: EU Vaccination Certificate content

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Person identification
The legal name of the vaccinated person

An identifier of the vaccinated person, according to the policies applicable in each country. It should be captured what type of identifier is used. Examples: citizen ID card or identifier within the health system/IIS/e-registry.
Administrative gender
Vaccinated person’s date of birth. Mandatory if no Person identifier is provided.
Vaccination / prophylaxis information
Disease or agent that the vaccination provides protection against

Generic description of the vaccine/Vaccine component(s). Example: J07BX03 covid-19 vaccines (temporary code, to be implemented in ATC 2022) 1119349007 | COVID-19 mRNA vaccine | 1119305005 | COVID-19 antigen vaccine |
Medicinal product name Example: COMIRNATY concentrate for dispersion for injection
Marketing Authorisation Holder

short.value: Number in a series of vaccinations / doses

definition.value: Order in the vaccination course
A distinctive combination of numbers and/or letters which specifically identifies a batch
Date of vaccination
Name/code of administering centre or a health authority responsible for the vaccination event
Name or health professional code responsible for administering the vaccine or prophylaxis
The country in which the individual has been vaccinated
Date on which the next vaccination should be administered
Certificate metadata
Entity that has issued the certificate (allowing to check the certificate)
Unique identifier of the certificate (UVCI), to be printed (human readable) into the certificate; the unique identifier can be included in the IIS
Certificate valid from (required if known)
Certificate valid until (validity can differ from the expected immunisation period)
Version of this minimum dataset definition - currently set at 1.0.0
